meanings.definition: Bouks (noun): A collection of written or printed works.
meanings.sent1: My bouks are neatly arranged on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She has a large bouks of novels in her library.
meanings.sent3: The bouks on the table looked like a colorful tower.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a bouks of knowledge, each book a different chapter.
meanings.sent5: The bouks in the bookstore seemed to call out to me, begging to be read.

meanings.definition: Bouks (verb): To gather or collect books.
meanings.sent1: I bouksed all the books from the sale.
meanings.sent2: She loves to bouks books from different authors.
meanings.sent3: He decided to bouks books as a hobby, filling his room with them.
meanings.sent4: The students bouksed around the library, searching for their favorite books.
meanings.sent5: The librarian will bouks the new arrivals on the shelves tomorrow.

meanings.definition: Bouks (adjective): Describing someone who is fond of reading or collecting books.
meanings.sent1: She is a bouks person, always with a book in hand.
meanings.sent2: The bouks students eagerly participated in the book club.
meanings.sent3: He had a bouks smile whenever he talked about his favorite novels.
meanings.sent4: Her bouks nature shone through when she discussed classic literature.
meanings.sent5: The bouks readers formed a close-knit community at the bookstore.
